questions.question: What layer of OSI model handles routing?
questions.explanation: Network Layer (Layer 3) is responsible for routing packets between networks.

questions.question: What does TCP stand for?
questions.explanation: TCP (Transmission Control Protocol) provides reliable, ordered delivery of data.

questions.question: What is the maximum number of hosts in a Class C network?
questions.explanation: Class C networks have 8 host bits, allowing 2^8-2 = 254 hosts (excluding network and broadcast).

questions.question: Which protocol is used for email transmission?
questions.explanation: SMTP (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol) is used for sending emails between servers.

questions.question: What does DNS resolve?
questions.explanation: DNS (Domain Name System) translates domain names to IP addresses.

questions.question: What is the difference between TCP and UDP?
questions.explanation: TCP is connection-oriented and reliable, while UDP is connectionless and faster.

questions.question: Which layer of OSI model handles error detection and correction?
questions.explanation: Data Link Layer (Layer 2) provides error detection and correction for the physical layer.

questions.question: What is the purpose of ARP (Address Resolution Protocol)?
questions.explanation: ARP resolves IP addresses to MAC addresses for local network communication.
